Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
OpenStreetMap (OSM) is a global mapping project that aims to create a free, editable map. It is contributed by volunteers, and users can collect and update geographic information through GPS, aerial imagery, and other sources. Here are some important information about OpenStreetMap:

Features
Openness: OSM data is completely open and can be used, modified, and shared by anyone. This makes it a very flexible tool for a variety of applications.
Community-driven: OSM relies on contributions from volunteers around the world. These contributors can be anyone, from professional geographers to ordinary users.
Rich data: OSM contains a variety of geographic information such as roads, buildings, rivers, mountains, public transportation routes, etc., covering urban and rural areas.
Multiple uses: Developers can use OSM data to build map applications, perform geographic analysis, or use it for navigation and positioning services.
Multiple formats: Data can be downloaded in multiple formats, such as XML, PBF files, etc., to facilitate different usage scenarios.

Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
We use the command line tools to download, we have the AWS CLI tools installed, download directly from AWS in the EU Central 1 and US West 2 regions. This is faster than downloading normally.
Command line:
aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://osm-planet-eu-central-1/
aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://osm-planet-us-west-2/
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, Europe, South America
